entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as catching Ron's eye and thinking the same thing about Professor Trelawney.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as thinking exactly the same thing as Harry about Professor Trelawney.

entities.name: professor trelawney
entities.description: Professor Trelawney is introduced as a character who points a shaking finger at Professor Umbridge and warns her of danger.

entities.name: professor umbridge
entities.description: Professor Umbridge is introduced as a character who continues to smile blandly at Professor Trelawney's warning.

relationships.description: Harry and Ron share the same thoughts about Professor Trelawney, thinking she is an old fraud.
Harry dislikes Professor Trelawney, as evidenced by his shared thoughts with Ron about her being a fraud.
Ron also dislikes Professor Trelawney, as he shares the same thoughts as Harry about her.
Harry dislikes Professor Umbridge, as evidenced by his shared thoughts with Ron about her being worse than Professor Trelawney.
Ron also dislikes Professor Umbridge, as he shares the same thoughts as Harry about her.
